intro: Craspedia, commonly known as the goldenweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the daisy family, Asteraceae. It is native to Australia and features showy, yellow or orange flowers that resemble daisies. The plants typically have hairy stems and leaves, and they often grow in dry, open habitats. Craspedia species are known for their ability to thrive in poor soils and are sometimes used in landscaping for their ornamental value. Some species are also used in traditional medicine by Indigenous Australian communities.
